main event: Many objects were picked up by ground radar and observed visually, appearing as a spot of light slightly larger than a star.
interesting points: The observation was made on June 7, 1957 between 2130 and 2145., The objects were seen for a duration of 15 minutes., The source of the observation was the U.S. Army., The objects were described as a white light moving in a straight level path before fading., The conclusion was that the objects could possibly be a satellite, balloon, or aircraft.
sighted object: many objects appearing as a spot of light
